Frances with Dan Edwards

Dressed for a costume ball on a steamer sailing down the Red Sea. On the left, Mrs. Lowell Thomas, disguised as a member of an oriental harem. Next to her an Australian girl representing Uncle Sam; the wild-looking warrior sitting in the middle is Squadron Leader Peter Drummond, Australian flying ace in the Palestine campaign, and today one of the higher ranking officers of the Royal Air Force. The dark-looking sheik on the right is not Othello. He is a Scotchman, Lieutenant McCall McCowan, an officer of the famous Black Watch [circa 1920]

Note: Dressed for a costume ball on a steamer sailing down the Red Sea. On the left, Mrs. Lowell Thomas, disguised as a member of an oriental harem. Next to her an Australian girl representing Uncle Sam; the wild-looking warrior sitting in the middle is Squadron Leader Peter Drummond, Australian flying ace in the Palestine campaign, and today one of the higher ranking officers of the Royal Air Force. The dark-looking sheik on the right is not Othello. He is a Scotchman, Lieutenant McCall McCowan, an officer of the famous Black Watch [circa 1920]

[Dressed for a costume ball on a steamer sailing down the Red Sea. On the left, Mrs. Lowell Thomas, disguised as a member of an oriental harem. Next to her an Australian girl representing Uncle Sam; the wild-looking warrior sitting in the middle is Squadron Leader Peter Drummond, Australian flying ace in the Palestine campaign, and today one of the higher ranking officers of the Royal Air Force. The dark-looking sheik on the right is not Othello. He is a Scotchman, Lieutenant McCall McCowan, an officer of the famous Black Watch [circa 1920]]

Frances Ryan Thomas: Photographs found with Frances Ryan Thomas's personal papers
Lowell Thomas
Miss Helen Arnold, the movie actress and myself. Taken on the Bridge of the S.S. Chicago. With life-preservers on [August - September 1917]
Verso: Miss Helen Arnold, the movie actress and myself. Taken on the Bridge of the S.S. Chicago. With life-preservers on [August - September 1917]
On the "Chicago" - during a life-preserver drill. Mrs. Arnold is with me. She was on her way to Naples to be in a movie. The man has an unsinkable suit on [August - September 1917]
Verso: On the "Chicago" - during a life-preserver drill. Mrs. Arnold is with me. She was on her way to Naples to be in a movie. The man has an unsinkable suit on [August - September 1917]
A sunset over the Seine River. Trocadero spires in the back. Eiffel Tower to left
Verso: A sunset over the Seine River. Trocadero spires in the back. Eiffel Tower to left
"We're going to get the boys out of the trenches by Christmas"
Verso: "We're going to get the boys out of the trenches by Christmas"
Vive la Parisienne! [2 copies]
Verso: Vive la Parisienne!
[Frances Ryan Thomas Personal Papers: Three men, a woman and a dog outside of a tent]
[Frances Ryan Thomas Personal Papers: Two men talking]

In the courtyard of what was the Kaiser's Palace on the Mt of Olives. It was taken during the reception which the new High Commissioner, Sir Herbert Samuel, gave. The statue is of the Kaiser dressed as a Crusader

Verso: In the courtyard of what was the Kaiser's Palace on the Mt of Olives. It was taken during the reception which the new High Commissioner, Sir Herbert Samuel, gave. The statue is of the Kaiser dressed as a Crusader
A street scene in Jaffa, Palestine
Verso: A street scene in Jaffa, Palestine
Quite a load
Verso: Quite a load
Caption: 3 [illegible] Tomb
A beggar woman in Jerusalem
Verso: A beggar woman in Jerusalem
A Jerusalem Jew, farmer
Verso: A Jerusalem Jew, farmer
On the beach at Aberdeen Scotland [circa 1920]
Verso: On the beach at Aberdeen Scotland [circa 1920]
This is Sir William Jury's car which he loans us on Sundays, Isn't it a beauty? Mr. Cummingham is acting as business Mgr. He is now in Scotland trying to arrange a tour for us, before we return

Verso: This is Sir William Jury's car which he loans us on Sundays, Isn't it a beauty? Mr. Cummingham is acting as business Mgr. He is now in Scotland trying to arrange a tour for us, before we return
Off for a Rickshaw ride at Colombo. My how hot it was! [circa 1921 - 1922]
Verso: Off for a Rickshaw ride at Colombo. My how hot it was! [circa 1921 - 1922]
A friend of ours who belongs to the Scottish regiment of The Black Watch - Colombo Ceylon [circa 1921 - 1922]
Verso: A friend of ours who belongs to the Scottish regiment of The Black Watch - Colombo Ceylon [circa 1921 - 1922]
A terrible picture of me-but taken in Shalimar gardens where the Indian Love-lyrics were written-near Lahore [circa 1921 - 1922]
Verso: A terrible picture of me-but taken in Shalimar gardens where the Indian Love-lyrics were written-near Lahore [circa 1921 - 1922]
Two of the sacred monkeys. There were hundreds around me but Tommy only got two in this picture [circa 1921 - 1922]
Verso: Two of the sacred monkeys. There were hundreds around me but Tommy only got two in this picture [circa 1921 - 1922]
This is an example of a child marriage-the girl is 8-the boy 10 and they have been married 3 years [circa 1921 - 1922]
Verso: This is an example of a child marriage-the girl is 8-the boy 10 and they have been married 3 years [circa 1921 - 1922]
How would you like a slice of bread? [circa 1921 - 1922]
Verso: How would you like a slice of bread? [circa 1921 - 1922]
Bathing along the Ganges [circa 1921 - 1922]
Verso: Bathing along the Ganges [circa 1921 - 1922]
A northern type. His vest is embroidered with gold thread. He is a rich merchant [circa 1921 - 1922]
Verso: A northern type. His vest is embroidered with gold thread. He is a rich merchant [circa 1921 - 1922]
This is a llama man (priest) from Lhasa, Thibet - Taken in Darjeeling [circa 1921 - 1922]
Verso: This is a llama man (priest) from Lhasa, Thibet - Taken in Darjeeling [circa 1921 - 1922]

This is our luggage arriving at Frere Hall, Karachi. By the direction of the shafts of the camel cart it looks as if it were going heavenward. Tommy and Cummingham are standing on the right [circa 1921 - 1922]

Verso: This is our luggage arriving at Frere Hall, Karachi. By the direction of the shafts of the camel cart it looks as if it were going heavenward. Tommy and Cummingham are standing on the right [circa 1921 - 1922]
A scene in Karachi. These people spread a few articles out in the street and "set up shop" [circa 1921 - 1922]
Verso: A scene in Karachi. These people spread a few articles out in the street and "set up shop" [circa 1921 - 1922]
T.R. [Theodore Roosevelt] and one of his Kenya elephants
Verso: T.R. [Theodore Roosevelt] and one of his Kenya elephants
